meanings.definition: To push or strike with the head or horns.
meanings.sent1: The goat bunted the fence to get to the other side.
meanings.sent2: The ram bunted the other ram during play.
meanings.sent3: The cow bunted the gate open, surprising the farmer.
meanings.sent4: The bull bunted the tree, shaking loose some leaves.
meanings.sent5: The deer bunted the bush, causing a rustling sound.

meanings.definition: To tap (a pitched ball) slowly without swinging in order to advance a base runner.
meanings.sent1: The baseball player bunted the ball to move the runner to second base.
meanings.sent2: The coach taught the team how to bunt effectively during practice.
meanings.sent3: The batter bunted the ball so gently, it barely moved.
meanings.sent4: She bunted the ball like a feather floating in the air.
meanings.sent5: The player bunted the ball with precision, surprising the opponents.

meanings.definition: To push or strike with the head or horns.
meanings.sent1: The sheep bunted the fence to reach the greener grass.
meanings.sent2: The goat bunted the other goat during their playful interaction.
meanings.sent3: The ram bunted the bucket, spilling its contents.
meanings.sent4: The cow bunted the gate, causing it to creak open.
meanings.sent5: The bull bunted the log, moving it slightly.
